gallery.beans

Class LocationBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • gallery.beans.AbstractBean<Location>
      • gallery.beans.LocationBean

  • @Path(value="/locations")
public class LocationBean
extends AbstractBean<Location>
    Location Enterprise Java Bean, maps to a Location Hibernate Entity. Also a REST service mapping to /YourPersonalPhotographOrganiser/resources/locations.

        @POST
@Consumes(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public void create(Location entity)
        Creates a Location. POST to /YourPersonalPhotographOrganiser/resources/locations. Will accept both application/xml as well as application/json.
        Overrides:

      • remove

        @DELETE
@Path(value="{id}")
public void remove(@PathParam(value="id")
                      java.lang.Long id)
        Removes a Location. DELETE to /YourPersonalPhotographOrganiser/resources/locations/{id}.
        Parameters:
        id - unique identifier for the Location, present in the url.

      • find

        @GET
@Path(value="{id}")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public Location find(@PathParam(value="id")
                              java.lang.Long id)
        Retrieves a Location. GET to /YourPersonalPhotographOrganiser/resources/locations/{id}. Can produce both application/xml as well as application/json when asked.
        Overrides:
        find in class AbstractBean<Location>
        Parameters:
        id - unique identifier for the comment, present in the url.
        Returns:
        Location entity
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - with status Response.Status.NOT_FOUND if Location with that id does not exist (any more).

      • discover

        @GET
@Path(value="{id}/discover")
public void discover(@PathParam(value="id")
                     java.lang.Long id)
        Checks a directory stored in "location" for new photographs or films. Starts a batch job, returns "204 No Content".
        Parameters:
        id - a Long representing the id of the Location entity.
        See Also:
        JobBean.addPhotographs(gallery.database.entities.Location)

      • verify

        public void verify(java.lang.Long id)
        Checks all the Photographs in a Location, based on their hash map and the contents of the file. Basically walks the directory tree. Starts a batch job, returns "204 No Content".
        Parameters:
        id - a Long representing the id of the Location entity.
        See Also:
        JobBean.addPhotographs(gallery.database.entities.Location)

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.Long id)
        Initializes GalleryPhotographs and Galleries based on the file structure.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the location.
        See Also:
        Gallery, GalleryPhotograph
